TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SwitchAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Identifies a switch used in an assembly, class, or member.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A SwitchAttribute attribute can be used on an assembly, class, constructor, method, property, or event.
The SwitchAttribute attribute can be used by tools that inspect an assembly for configuration settings.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the SwitchAttribute attribute to identify the switch used in an assembly. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSource> class.
[!code-cs[System.Diagnostics.TraceSource2#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.diagnostics.swi_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Diagnostics.TraceSource2#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.diagnostics.swi_1_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string switchName, class System.Type switchType) cil managed

Docs.param: The display name of the switch.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the name and the type of the switch.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `switchName` parameter should match the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Switch.DisplayName%2A> property of the switch.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the SwitchAttribute constructor to create a switch attribute. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSource> class.
[!code-cs[System.Diagnostics.TraceSource2#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.diagnostics.swi_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Diagnostics.TraceSource2#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.diagnostics.swi_2_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Diagnostics.SwitchAttribute[] GetAll(class System.Reflection.Assembly assembly) cil managed

Docs.param: The assembly to check for switch attributes.
Docs.summary: Returns all switch attributes for the specified assembly.
Docs.returns: An array that contains all the switch attributes for the assembly.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the GetAll method to identify the switches used in an assembly. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSource> class.
[!code-cs[System.Diagnostics.TraceSource2#12](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.diagnostics.swi_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Diagnostics.TraceSource2#12](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.diagnostics.swi_0_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the description of the switch.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SwitchDescription property typically indicates the function of the switch.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the display name of the switch.
Docs.value: The display name of the switch.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SwitchName property should match the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Switch.DisplayName%2A> property of the switch.
## Examples The following code example displays the value the SwitchName property for all switches used in an assembly. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSource> class.
[!code-cs[System.Diagnostics.TraceSource2#12](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.diagnostics.swi_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Diagnostics.TraceSource2#12](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.diagnostics.swi_3_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: SwitchName is set to an empty string.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of the switch.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example displays the value of the SwitchType property for all switches used in an assembly. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSource> class.
